message.content:
cs.DC, cs.NI, cs.OS, cs.SE, cs.SY

This paper is likely to belong to the Distributed, Parallel, and Cluster Computing (cs.DC) sub-category as it discusses virtualization technology and its impact on High Performance Computing (HPC) applications. It also presents a novel approach to optimize job deadlines in virtual machines, which is a common problem in distributed computing systems. 

The Networked and Internet Computing (cs.NI) sub-category is also likely as the paper discusses the benefits of virtualization technology in commercial clouds, which are often based on networked and distributed computing systems. 

The Operating Systems (cs.OS) sub-category is another possibility as the paper discusses the performance penalty of virtualization technology and the need to optimize job deadlines in virtual machines, which are both related to operating system design and implementation. 

The Software Engineering (cs.SE) sub-category is also possible as the paper presents a novel algorithm for optimizing job deadlines in virtual machines, which is a software engineering problem. 

Finally, the Systems and Control (cs.SY) sub-category is a less likely possibility as the paper borrows concepts from signal processing and statistical techniques to optimize job deadlines, which are related to systems and control theory.
